decision.reasoning: Seahawks regular season stats show dominance: 339 total first downs (125 rush, 179 pass, 35 pen) vs opponents' 291 (83 rush, 176 pass, 32 pen), indicating superior overall production especially in rushing (125 vs 83). Third down efficiency 82/206 (~39.8%). However, Patriots playoff performance is superior and more relevant: 3-0 with wins 16-3 vs Chargers (dominant D), 28-16 vs Texans (balanced), 10-7 vs Broncos (elite D in low-scoring grinder). Patriots boast league-best explosive creation rate 13.6% on offense, +2.8% success rate (4th in NFL), and Maye MVP-caliber with 17.3% tight-window throws (4th among QBs). Seahawks have best explosive-play differential (+4.7%), but Pats' playoff pedigree, defensive grit in close games, and explosive upside undervalue them at 38.6%. Market overrates Seahawks' regular-season edge; stats scream value on Pats in high-stakes SB.
